title: Guess The Country Capital
stack: React / Expo / JavaScript / Picker DropDown / React Hooks
desc: A quiz app to test knowledge of world capitals.
more: Mobile-first quiz flow with quick feedback and clean UI.
writeup: Concept: A fast, playful trivia experience for short sessions.
Planning: Mapped the question flow, states, and UI hierarchy for small screens.
Development: Built reusable question components and state logic with hooks.

title: Sustainable Clothing Website
desc: A website promoting sustainable clothing choices.
more: Wireframes and user flows for a sustainability-driven brand.
writeup: Concept: A brand that promotes sustainable fashion choices.
Planning: Mapped user journeys and key screens (home, explore, saved, planner).
Development: Produced wireframes with eco-impact messaging and trust cues.

title: Hawker Hero
desc: A recommendation and rating platform for local food stalls.
more: Brand-led UI with product listing, filtering, and checkout flow.
writeup: Concept: A local hawker discovery and rating platform.
Planning: Defined user flows for browse, filter, and checkout.
Development: Implemented menu-first UI with reviews and ratings.

title: Escape Room
desc: A virtual reality escape room game.
more: Immersive VR puzzles with guided storytelling.
writeup: Concept: A narrative-led VR escape experience designed to immerse players through story-driven exploration and puzzle solving.

Planning: Sketched puzzle pacing and difficulty progression, planned player guidance (visual cues, lighting, signage), and mapped the environment layout to lead players naturally without excessive instructions.

Development: Built the experience in Unity and coded interactions using C#. Implemented interactive puzzles (object pickup/use, triggers, and condition checks) and refined onboarding so players learn controls smoothly while keeping the challenge engaging.

title: FoodWaste Tracker
desc: An app to track and reduce food waste.
more: Team-built app with dashboards and waste tracking.
writeup: Concept: Built a food waste tracking solution to help households log food usage and reduce unnecessary disposal through better visibility and habits.
Planning: Designed the data model and endpoints needed for tracking (create/read/update/delete food records), identified dashboard and chart requirements, and coordinated tasks within the team.

Development: Developed mobile application features using a REST API to handle CRUD operations. Implemented API integration (GET/POST/PUT/DELETE), updated UI state based on server responses, and visualised trends through charts and tracking summaries.

title: Learn@RP
desc: A redesign of the Learn@RP platform for better user experience.
more: Redesigned navigation and clarity for core learning tasks.
writeup: Concept: A refreshed Learn@RP interface focused on clarity, calm visuals, and faster navigation for students, with a clean dashboard-first experience.

Planning: Identified usability issues such as cluttered content, unclear priorities, and inconsistent navigation. Restructured the menu and page hierarchy, and planned a reusable layout system (cards, headers, buttons) so key actions are always easy to find.

Development: Built the UI in Figma using Auto Layout and reusable components to keep spacing, alignment, and sizing consistent across screens. Used a calm green-based colour system (primary green for CTAs, progress, and highlights; deeper green for navigation areas) paired with soft neutrals for forms and cards to improve readability and reduce visual stress. Added clear hierarchy through typography, rounded card sections, and consistent icon/chevron patterns. Designed a spinner/loading state component and applied variants + prototype interactions to show feedback (loading/active states) and smoother user flows.

title: Income Expense Tracker
desc: An app to track personal income and expenses.
more: Personal finance tracker with clear category breakdowns.
writeup: Concept: A mobile finance tracker that supports daily logging of income and expenses and provides clear category-based insights.
Planning: Collaborated on transaction structure (amount, type, category, date, notes) and mapped the user flow to minimise taps for adding and reviewing records.

Development: As the team frontend developer, I implemented the React Native/Expo UI, created reusable components (transaction cards, category chips, summary tiles), and ensured the data is presented in a clear and consistent way across the dashboard and history views.

title: Study Tracker
desc: A study tracker that logs sessions and displays progress using a backend API.
more: API-driven study session tracker with CRUD features and progress summaries.
writeup: Concept: Built a study tracker that allows users to record study sessions and monitor progress, with data managed through a backend API instead of hardcoding.
Planning: Applied C346 concepts by defining CRUD requirements and data fields (subject, duration, date, notes), then planned API endpoints and how the frontend would consume them in a clear flow.

Development: Integrated the React frontend with the backend REST API for create, read, update, and delete operations. Implemented API calls, handled responses/errors, and updated UI state so session lists and progress summaries refresh correctly after each action.

title: SkinCare Routine Tracker
desc: An app to track skincare routines and progress.
more: Skincare routine tracker with reminders and progress visualization.
writeup: Concept: A mobile skincare tracker that helps users organise routines and record daily progress with an easy CRUD-based system.
Planning: Mapped the user journey to minimise steps for adding and updating routines, defined data fields (routine name, steps, frequency, notes), and planned key screens for management and tracking.

Development: As the team frontend developer, I built the React Native UI and connected CRUD actions to AsyncStorage (create/read/update/delete). This ensures the userâ€™s routine data is saved locally and loads correctly each time the app is opened.

title: 3D NameCard
desc: A 3D NameCard application built in Unity.
writeup: This project is an AR-based 3D name card created using Unity.
The main purpose is to enhance a normal name card by allowing users to scan it and view my name in 3D through AR, making the experience more modern and interactive.
I designed the name card in Adobe Illustrator and exported the design assets for use in Unity.
After importing the design into Unity, I set up the AR environment and positioned the 3D name so it appears clearly above the card when viewed through the camera.
This project shows my ability to integrate design tools with real-time development software to create an engaging digital experience.
